mapper.sql: ID, NAME, AUTHOR, PRICE, PUBLISHDATE, TYPE, ADDRESS
mapper.insert: insert into TEST_BOOK (ID, NAME, AUTHOR, PRICE, PUBLISHDATE, TYPE, ADDRESS) values (#{ID,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, #{NAME,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{AUTHOR,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{PRICE,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, #{PUBLISHDATE,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{TYPE,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, #{ADDRESS,jdbcType=VARCHAR})

insert into TEST_BOOK
ID,
NAME,
AUTHOR,
PRICE,
PUBLISHDATE,
TYPE,
ADDRESS,

mapper.update:
update TEST_BOOK
NAME = #{NAME,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
AUTHOR = #{AUTHOR,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
PRICE = #{PRICE,jdbcType=DECIMAL},
PUBLISHDATE = #{PUBLISHDATE,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
TYPE = #{TYPE,jdbcType=DECIMAL},
ADDRESS = #{ADDRESS,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
where ID = #{ID,jdbcType=DECIMAL}

update TEST_BOOK set NAME = #{NAME,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, AUTHOR = #{AUTHOR,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, PRICE = #{PRICE,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, PUBLISHDATE = #{PUBLISHDATE,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, TYPE = #{TYPE,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, ADDRESS = #{ADDRESS,jdbcType=VARCHAR} where ID = #{ID,jdbcType=DECIMAL}
mapper.select: select * from (select t.*,rownum rn from test_book t) where rn>=#{start} and rn <=#{end}
select count(*) from (select t.*,rownum rn from test_book t)
